text: hi guys I'm Laura Vitale on this episode
of Laura in the kitchen I want to show
you how to make a panzanella salad
panzanella salad is nothing more than an
Italian vegetable and bread salad
there's no lettuce in it at all so it's
just filled with chunky vegetables and
stale bread and like an oil and vinegar
dressing it's to die for I make mine a
tiny bit different by grilling the bread
rather than putting it in it just slices
because I find that I get too mushy and
that's not what I'm looking for when I
make this so I really like the taste of
the grilled bread in this version of it
so let's go over the ingredients to get
started you're gonna need some red bell
pepper fresh cucumber red onion tomatoes
garlic cloves some stale bread extra
virgin olive oil balsamic vinegar salt
salt pepper dried oregano and fresh
basil
those are your ingredients now
traditionally it's really most mostly
the tomatoes and red onion and sometimes
a red bell pepper but I really like the
addition of the cucumber
I think it's crisp I think it's fresh
and I absolutely love it and everywhere
I've ever had it had a restaurants
around here they've had it with cucumber
and I really like it so first thing
you're gonna do and it's got a grill pan
nice and hot to toast our bread which is
the first order of business and this is
stale bread and this is a chibok that
you can either use a ciabatta you can
use a baguette whatever you'd like and
